prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Install required packages if not already installed


# Load required packages
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)

# 1. Read the count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# 2. Read the annotation data
annotation_data <- read_tsv("SRP021193.colData.tsv")

# 3. Get the sample ids from the annotation data
sample_ids <- annotation_data$diagnosis

# 4. Subset the count table to include only the sample columns
count_table_samples <- count_table[, 2:ncol(count_table)]

# 5. Subset the annotation data to include only the sample columns
annotation_data_samples <- annotation_data[, 2:ncol(annotation_data)]

# 6. Find genes specific for each "group" in the annotation data using statistical tests
group_specific_genes <- lapply(unique(annotation_data$group), function(group) {
  group_samples <- sample_ids[annotation_data$group == group]
  group_count_table <- count_table_samples[, group_samples]
  
  # Perform statistical test, e.g., differential expression analysis
  # Replace the code below with the specific statistical test you want to use
  # Example: t-test
  t_test_results <- apply(group_count_table, 1, function(counts) {
    t.test(counts[group_samples %in% rownames(count_table_samples)], counts[!group_samples %in% rownames(count_table_samples)])
  })
  
  significant_genes <- rownames(group_count_table)[sapply(t_test_results, function(result) result$p.value < 0.05)]
  
  return(significant_genes)
})

# 7. Combine the group-specific genes into a single vector
all_group_specific_genes <- unlist(group_specific_genes)

# 8. Subset the count table to include only the group-specific genes
count_table_group_specific_genes <- count_table[rownames(count_table) %in% all_group_specific_genes, ]

# 9. Perform PCA on the count table with group-specific genes
pca <- prcomp(count_table_group_specific_genes[, 2:ncol(count_table_group_specific_genes)],
              scale = TRUE)

# 10. Plot PCA and color code by "group" variable in the annotation data
plot(pca$x[, 1], pca$x[, 2], col = annotation_data$group)
```
Note: Make sure you have the necessary packages installed, such as "readxl" and "tidyverse". Adjust the code based on your specific requirements and statistical tests.
